objectives: Apply theoretical concepts to analyze brain-computer interfaces
learning_style_adaptations: Use of diagrams, charts, and mind maps

multiple_intelligences.linguistic: Write a story or essay about brain-computer interfaces
multiple_intelligences.logical_mathematical: Analyze patterns and create logical arguments about brain-computer interfaces
multiple_intelligences.spatial: Create visual representations or mind maps of brain-computer interfaces
multiple_intelligences.bodily_kinesthetic: Role-play or act out scenarios related to brain-computer interfaces
multiple_intelligences.musical: Create a song or rhythm exercise about brain-computer interfaces
multiple_intelligences.interpersonal: Collaborate in groups to discuss brain-computer interfaces
multiple_intelligences.intrapersonal: Reflect individually on personal connection to brain-computer interfaces
multiple_intelligences.naturalistic: Categorize and classify concepts related to brain-computer interfaces

content.basic: Simplified texts and basic vocabulary about brain-computer interfaces
content.intermediate: Standard complexity materials with support about brain-computer interfaces
content.advanced: Complex authentic materials and academic texts about brain-computer interfaces

process.grouping: Individual, pairs, small groups, or whole class based on preference
process.choice: Multiple activity options aligned with learning style

differentiation.environment: Well-lit space with visual displays and projection capabilities

warm_up.description: Students examine images related to brain-computer interfaces and discuss

main_activities.learning_style_adaptation: Use of diagrams, charts, and mind maps
main_activities.description: Students receive information about brain-computer interfaces through visual modality
Students practice language related to brain-computer interfaces using visual approach
Students produce original content about brain-computer interfaces demonstrating intermediate thinking

discussion_prompts: How does brain-computer interfaces affect people?
What are the advantages and disadvantages of brain-computer interfaces?
How would you solve problems related to brain-computer interfaces?

vocabulary_support.tier_2: Academic and topic-specific words for brain-computer interfaces
vocabulary_support.tier_3: Domain-specific technical terms related to brain-computer interfaces

homework_options.required: Core assignment at intermediate level using visual approach

teacher_notes.grouping_suggestions: Flexible grouping based on readiness and interest
teacher_notes.time_management: Build in flexibility for different pacing needs

common_difficulties: Students may lack background knowledge about brain-computer interfaces
Vocabulary may be challenging for some students
Some students may need more processing time
methodology: UDL + Differentiated Instruction + CLT + Multiple Intelligences
references: CAST Universal Design for Learning Guidelines
